title: I've seen the Taj Mahal. What does 'I've' mean? - Quora

response.answer_text: I've seen the Taj Mahal. What does "I've" mean? I’ve is short of I have. I have seen Taj Mahal. While writing or even speaking some words are used with contraction. A contraction means a shortened form of a word (or group of words) that omits certain letters or sounds. In most contractions, an apostrophe represents the missing letters. The most common contractions are made up of verbs, auxiliaries, or modals attached to other words: He would=He'd. I have=I've. They are=They're. Did not = Didn’t and so on.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Priti Gadling प्रिती गडलिंग

response.answer_text: ‘I have’ is the full form of I’ve. “I have seen Taj Mhal” Here ‘have’ acts as an auxiliary verb and helps to express the perfect aspect of the main verb ‘see’ to make the sentence as a present perfect tense. I have have a luxury car. Here the 1st ‘have’ is an auxiliary or helping verb and the 2nd ‘have’ is the main verb.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Priti Gadling प्रिती गडलिंग

response.answer_text: I’ve is the short form of ‘I have’ (I have seen the Taj Mahal), just like ‘you’ve’ for ‘you have’, ‘they’ve’ for ‘they have’. :)
